text: hi everyone can the Nicole Tano here the
internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of this new post
Malone album Austin brand new LP from
guitarist and vocalist Austin post AKA
post Malone keeping busy apparently and
giving us a follow-up album too is 2022
Record 12 karat toothache which I didn't
love to be honest but I think this
record was still an interesting move for
post in theory really shedding a lot of
that rapid trap pretense you may have
heard on his earlier Works to make it
even clearer who and what he is at his
core a singer-songwriter who kind of
dresses up his tunes and whatever
Aesthetics he sees fit although the
Aesthetics lately have been pretty awful
because while in one breath 12 karat
toothache was a more personal and
stripped back record for post the
production and vocals were so glossy and
airbrushed and blissed out to where the
whole thing sounded soulless really
artificial No Doubt depth sonically
anyway and this time around I was hoping
we'd get something maybe more rustic or
more intimate especially since it seems
like post Malone is trying to sell us on
this more raw and unfiltered image of
himself and I'm sad to say this record
feels only maybe a bit more material and
textured than it's washed out
predecessor I mean the opener is pretty
good with its painfully relatable lyrics
which deal with insecurity in a
relationship not seeing in yourself what
somebody else sees in you the
songwriting and guitar work on this cut
is very cobain-esque and that acoustic
guitar is maybe the most natural
sounding thing on the entire album even
the vocals come across pretty naked
despite the fact they are soaked in some
Reverb I say this because if you like
the sound of this song Get Ready to be
disappointed because we are immediately
leaving flavor town because really
quickly the production on this thing
gets overdone and overblown like with
the larger than Life chorus vocals and
hulking droning tones in the background
of something real which just all builds
into this obnoxiously impenetrable
monolith there's also chemical which I
thought was a pretty decent summary
single with some concerning but
sympathetic lyrics about the highs and
lows of chemical dependency and again I
like the track but uh the sound of it is
just so damn glossy I'm dying to hear a
piece of instrumentation that feels like
it wasn't computer generated like with
the track hold my breath for example
what was post Malone and his
collaborators doing with the vocal
harmonies on this track they're horrible
they sound really pitchy and thin like
they're being fed through one of those
miniature Tesla coils is is that too
esoteric of a reference okay you know
what they sound like evil bony bear
yeah we're going with that either way
the sound of it is just so grossly
artificial and it's unfortunate because
the emotions behind the song and in the
lyrics Sound genuine the chords and
instrumental Arrangement on overdrive
leave a lot to be desired too as it's
maybe the most cliche and formulaic
piece of music on the entire record I
didn't know we were going to get so
generic that were like you know
bordering on YouTube royalty free
acoustic soft rock levels of blah this
record in the worst way just feels like
being caught between two worlds on one
side you have the music just sounding so
lacking in terms of human touch but then
on top of that you have post Malone
singing about sobering up getting clean
his struggles with that or other
relatable topics with kind of a romantic
angle like on sign me up where he is so
love sick and willing to bend over
backwards is kind of compromising
himself so yeah there are tracks on this
thing where there is that split that
Dynamic but there are others where uh
not just the instrumentals are taking a
nose dive the lyrics are R2 like too
cool to die which is one of a few songs
on this thing that have almost an 80s
throwback stranger things Revival sort
of thing going on and honestly I'm not
really loving post Malone going back to
these 80s Vibes it's kind of like all
the idyllic sterility of this era of
music but none of the nostalgic charm
Plus on this track we have lyrics about
this new fast-moving romance that are so
sweet they're going to give me freaking
diabetes not to mention the painfully
corny chorus of the world keeps getting
hotter baby but I'm too cool to die on
the song socialite we have some groovy
acoustic guitar strumming posts vocals
hug the border between singing and
rapping in this track lyrically speaking
pretty much opens the floodgates for
Pure cringe like with uh I Pummel the
coochie I'm Bobby Boucher maybe that's
why they put up with all my [ __ ]
yeah Adam Sandler and pummeling coochie
is just a visual combo I didn't need
today the track is loaded with endless
cultural references is some of them are
cute
others of them not so cute it's all very
much giving Stoner white guy on the
beach with his acoustic guitar and all
of his college age friends playing in
front of a fire at night yeah just just
absolutely rancid Vibes rancid Vibes
speedometer sees post Malone going full
synth pop once again and there's so much
gloss and Shimmer and saturation in this
mix that the vocal harmonies on the hook
just sound like mush plus we have
painfully on the nose lyrics like turn
the lights off and put the record on
that you showed me that makes you so
horny let's make a baby tonight deeper

to pen bars like record companies really

[ __ ] singing karaoke well one
this could maybe be due to the fact that

it's not like the Music and Sound Of
This Record is entirely a original
anyway there are moments on this thing

enough is enough sounds like what you

producing a collab between AJR and

Rotation by the time we hit buyer beware

that I I just want I just want to take a
nap land mine instrumentally sounds like

least the theme song to a tween drama
that just had one season in the 90s
green thumb lyrically is a portrayal of
two x's who have gone their separate
ways the tracks Melodies and chord
progressions are really interesting
curious winding it's not the most
straightforward song and I think it's
the better for it post kind of portrays
himself as being in a better place than
he would be if he were one of the many
guys kind of waiting for this woman to
pay attention to him love him though in
a way he does still seem to be holding
out hope it's one of the better written
songs here even if it doesn't come to
the strongest narrative conclusion and
then with the closing cut we have just a
very Hollow finish for this record the
Dynamics are awful especially when these
just pounding drums come in at the very
end swallowing everything I don't know
why it's mixed and produced like this it
sounds like trash I'm blown away that
this is like allegedly supposed to be a
professionally produced mainstream music
album like there's countless at home and
DIY producers on the internet uh that
could have put this together better and
had it just sounded great yeah not a
great record from postie unfortunately
not a great record a few standout songs
here and there some decent and personal
lyrics but he continues to feed his
songs Through utterly unflattering
production as well as toss out some
truly awful lyrics here and there too
didn't like this one feeling a decent
